comment: Her class involves a lot of projects but she grades based on efforts. It's advisable to show up every class and do all the online discussions. She is easy to talk to and is very considerate. Take her!

I love Dr. Strider! She is one of the sweetest ladies I've ever met and she truly loves her students. Easy class if you participate in the discussions and you learn a lot of valuable info. No tests, a few projects that are easy and useful, and the occasional online discussion. Take her class!

She is nice and the class is a good alternative to 1101. But she was slightly disorganized and was a bit unclear on what she wanted in her papers. I would take her class again only if hers was the last 1121 open. (which there are not many of to begin with)

Its better than ksu 1101 but unless you really like community service and stuff dont take this clss. She is very boring and confusing in what she wants. I would not take the class again, id go crazy with boredom

If you don't like social issues then don't take this class. You do have to participate and complete work, so if you are not willing to do either then you will fail.  If you want a Type A personality teaching you then DO NOT take her class. She is fair and fun.

This is an excellent alternative to KSU 1101 and this Prof. understands and is helpful to the nontraditional learner. Show up, speak up and get your A. Some busy work that is graded on completion, not quality. Likes to be challenged, but be respectful. Community service/group project can be on anything. Good teacher, don't hesitate to take her.

She issues many projects in the class that are group based. You have a five page paper due that is graded on effort, just like everything else in the class. Don't need the book, she uses powerpoints in class and can be used on the tests. You can still get an A if you don't go to class. She wants to hear opinions though, so be prepared to speak up.

Very kind hearted person, however very unorganized. Also very thoughtful. She spends 70% of the class just talking about what is on her mind and even what she thinks of while she is speaking. Test are most likely straight from the book. Often released from class early. o what is required and there should be no reason you cannot make an A.
likes to talk about whatevers on her mind. wants some of your input here and there, but mainly wants to hear her voice. very nice and sweet.

She openly talks about her passions. The class was very easy and it ignited the conversation on the daily struggles of the real world. If you do not want to debate don't attend. However, the discussions touched up on a bit of everything. This is college, learn to speak your mind!

Ridiculously easy A. Grades for effort. The only thing you have to do is just go to the lecture and sit. A few projects here and there, but it doesn't have to be elaborate. She is very strong in her values though. If you're a very opinionated person I suggest you don't take her class unless you want to butt heads/get shot down.

Her main goal is to create discussion and get you to think. If the class doesn't participate it will be a very boring class. All the info on her test are straight out of the book. The supposed random info like the name of the library and when it was built is actually in the book. Not a hard class.

This is an easy but very boring and frustrating class. Rather then focusing on the book and using the class hours for the intended use, she elaborates on racial discrimination and social injustice. Her class is an easy A, as she grades for effort and completion, but if you want your money's worth I suggest going with another professor.

Class is BORING! Attend was not mandatory but she gives out info during class for test. Not very helpful or clear but do the work and you'll make an A. She will waste class time and talk about NOTHING! Just smile and nod!
